Name: Rush in the Forest: Three Little Pigs
Description:
Rush in the forest: Three Little Pigs - is a family board game. All the components of the game are made from ecofriendly plywood. The game board and the rest of the elements are assembled as a constructor in the 3-d puzzle format. The glue is not required for the game assembling. Age for self-assembly of the components of the game is 14+. Age to participate with the game is 8+. Gameplay - throw a dice's, go your character (pig) on the playing board and collect resources for building a house. During the game, you may be hampered by a secondary character (Wolf) or accidentally dropped effect cards (which may both interfere and help you). The goal of the game is to assemble the house faster than the other players.

—description from the publisher
Families: Folk Tales & Fairy Tales: Three Little Pigs

Name: Zombie Doctor: The Classic Horror Expansion Pack
Description:
The Zombie Doctor world is officially growing with The Classic Horror Expansion Pack.

These are four iconic characters which can be mixed with the original characters from the base Zombie Doctor game, or played with as a standalone game. Pain or Gain Cards from the base Zombie Doctor game will be needed and not supplied with the expansion pack.

The characters are:


     Dr Jekyll and Mr Hyde
     The Mummy
     The Invisible Man
     Dracula


The characters' design are inspired by the old films and classic novels. They're incredibly suitable for the game's mechanics as they turn from one thing into another! Perfect for fans of the classics or a great addition to your horror games.

—description from the publisher

Name: シープマッチ (Sheep Match)
Description:
A bunch of cards have all kinds of different sheep on them. On your turn you draw one card at random from the player to your right and then play as many sheep cards as you want, telling a story to connect them as you go along. Then the other players vote on whether the story made sense or not; if at least half say yes, you can just discard the cards, otherwise you have to draw to replace them.

The goal is to get rid of all your cards. However, the game continues until one team wins. The only catch is, nobody knows what team they're on until they run out of cards! Cards that tell you what team you're on are dealt at the start of the game but are kept face-down and unchecked until you run out of cards. This keeps voting honest even as the game goes on.

While the rules are in Japanese, the cards have no text, so the game can be played in any language.

-- user summary

Name: Out of Line: Nature Calls
Description:
Out of Line: Nature Calls is a leg-crossing game of Russian roulette.  A stand-alone expansion of our Out of Line series, players race to the front of a line of portable toilets at an outdoor concert.  The deck is full of cards to help you cheat your way to the front, but you never can tell when nature might strike.  The further you get into the deck the more desperate the race becomes because the clock is always ticking on a full bladder.

To win, you simply have to be the first one to get to a portable toilet without having any accidents along the way.  Nature could call at any moment and no one may make it to the front of the line, so use all the tricks up your sleeves to cheat your way to the front.

A player's turn consists of 3 easy steps:
1. Roll a dice and move that line up 
2. Draw a card and hope nature doesn’t strike
3. Take an action (play a card, move to the back of a line or just discard a card)

Player cards allow you to do things like:
• Move a player to the end of a line
• Force a player out of line
• Let a foodie cut into the front of the line
• Add people to the end of a line
• Temporarily close down a portable toilet
• Stop another player from playing a card

-description from designer

Name: Indictment
Description:
Politics is a terrible and scary race to be in. Everyone has scandals, big and small, that they wish wouldn't see the light of day. However, the press always seems to find them...

In Indictment, players are politicians who are working hard to bury their scandals before the press can find them. Each turn, players play either scandal cards or cover-up cards. A player then chooses which scandal to reveal, hoping the next, bigger scandal is just around the corner to occupy the press. If they can't play a same level (number) of scandal or higher, they have to pick up all the revealed scandals.  If you play the same level (i.e. same number) of scandal as your opponent, they can stack and give you special bonus actions.

Eventually, once you've eliminated of all your hidden scandals, you can finally get to putting those nagging open scandals behind you, knowing you will not be the last one left in the press.

There are no winners in this game of politics, with only the last one left holding onto scandals being indicted and losing.

Name: The Siege of Tyler City
Description:
A 20 minute old west war game for 2 players

The outlaw David Glynn has been rolling across the west ransacking and looting every town he and his gang come across. Tyler City is next in his cross hairs. The folks of Tyler City know he’s coming and will not go down without a fight. Welcome to the deadly game of maneuvers, counter-maneuvers, and shootouts in the old west. Welcome to the Siege of Tyler City!

The Siege of Tyler City is a quick area control game where each player sets their sides’ actions for the round, then plays out those actions in order. At the end of a round, if one player has met one of their winning conditions, the game ends and that player is the winner.

—description from the publisher

Name: Biatlonmánie
Description: A boardgame published together with Czech biathlon union. It simulates biathlon races. Players roll the dice to move their pawns. Another dice is used for shooting simulation. There are more variant of races. Players can also use some of biathlonist card (best czech racers are included in second revised edition) to improve their skills. The track on board copies the areal in Nové MÄ›sto - one of the most popular tracks in biathlon world cup.

Name: Puzzleboard game
Description:
Puzzleboard game (for 2 - 6 people)
          (print&play game)
The board game consists of 6*9=54 piece puzzle element and a regular hexagonal dice. The basic board consists of the common play area which is avilable for everyone, and the 6 individual play areas.
At the beginning of the game, the players agree to wich picture (figure) the each want to complete at wich area. In case of debate, the decision will be made by the dice.
After the decision, the puzzle elements have to be placed at the common play area ofthe hexagon, which can happen according to the player's agreement:
- placed according the chosen picture (figure) at the furthest slice from the individual game area,
- the chosen picture at the furthest slice from the individual game area: mixed,
- the puzzle elements are mixed  at the hexagon of the common game area: with the agreement of every player.
Regular movement of the puzzle elements: at the common or individual game area,in patallel with one of the without skipping another element.
After rolling the dice, the number on top of dice will determine the number of steps.
One step is when a player moves a puzzle element to a specific direction: towards the individual game area of the player, without having another puzzle element in the way (without skipinng another element). If there is an element in the way, it should be movedorderly beforhand. If the element not reach individual's game area, it is has to be parked (stored temporarily). In case the puzzle element at the individual game area can only be rotated to the correct position, then it should be moved (orderly) to the O sign first, abd then rotate it here.
The winner is the one who completes the picture (figure) at his own game area.

Name: Footprint: World Edition
Description:
Planet Earth is struggling under high levels of pollution. Your task is to buy and invest in eco-innovations to build a successful green economy which reduces Earth’s pollution. Along the way you can win bonuses by answering fascinating facts about the world's geography, wildlife and environment. You’ll have to keep an eye on the clock though, as you need to reduce all the pollution before time runs out!

Footprint is a semi-cooperative euro-style card game where players answer bonus questions and buy and invest in eco-innovations to remove pollution cubes from Earth. There are three levels of questions in the game to suit different ages and abilities (beginner, medium and advanced).

The winner is the player who removes the most pollution from Earth, however should players run out of turn cards before all the pollution is removed, everyone loses!

—description from the publisher

Name: La manufacture Lilienfeld (fan expansion for T.I.M.E Stories)
Description:
1910. Germany. Bob is sending agents in a weapon factory. Illegal time travels have been detected. You must discover who, and why... But be careful, this mission will ask you to stay as stealth as possible if you don't want to ring the alarm !

This is my first Time Stories scenario. It has been tested by few groups of players.
Scenario is finished, you can download it and play. 
Important : Just read the set up in the General forum

I hope you will appreciate to play it.

Allemagne, 1910, les agents sont envoyés dans une usine d'armement pour enquêter sur une série de voyages temporels illégaux.
Mais attention, un comportement suspect pourrait entraver le bon déroulement de cette mission...

C'est mon premier scénario réalisé pour TIME Stories.
Le scénario est terminé et plusieurs tests ont été réalisés.
Le scénario est disponible en téléchargement et prêt à jouer.
IMPORTANT : La mise en place du scénario est détaillée dans le forum général

Name: Knot Dice: Squared
Description:
Knot Dice Squared is an expansion to Knot Dice, with 26 more dice of 3 different types. New rules are included for many of the original games, and a puzzle book provides new puzzles incorporating the new dice. It also add tokens to accommodate 2 more players in some of the games.

You still create Celtic knot designs with these beautiful dice, but the new patterns make for slightly more difficult games and a much wider variety of designs.

Name: Brink: aim for the edge but don't go over!
Description:
Brink is a dexterity game for the whole family. It is easy to learn but hard to master.

You throw the plastic cards over the table, aiming to stop the cards on the edge for the highest score. Just a little bit too far and you don't score any points.

Name: Dragonfire: Ranger Wood Elf Promo Card
Description:
Ranger Female Wood Elf promo character card distributed in Game Trade Magazine #220 (June 2018).

Provides a new Female Wood Elf Ranger character for players to use, unique to this promotional distribution.

This promo card is for a Wood Elf Ranger with the Keen Senses ability: Make skill check. Success - Shift surprise effect one player to the left.

Name: Dragon Fortress
Description:
In Dragon Fortress you will build an Estate that consists of various crops, farms, barns, mills etc. Also, you must protect these valuable estate assets from approaching dragons, who wish to burn these structures down. Protecting your estate is accomplished by building Fortress Tower structures. A careful balance of Estate and Fortress cards are needed to be victorious in Dragon Fortress. You must have the largest Estate and defeat the dragons!

On your turn you will draw a card and play a card from your hand to your Estate line. This line will build linearly from left to right. You may also draw from the gold supply to help you purchase valuable upgrades for your Estate cards. Drawing from the supply on your turn may introduce a dragon that will attack your estate. The dragon will enter your Estate on the front line and move through each card until it burns your crops or is defeated by your towers.

Victory points are scored for defeating dragons and building the most lucrative Estate. The player with the most victory points after the last dragon is defeated will win the game.

-description from designer

Name: うかい (Ukai)
Description:
Ukai is a historic form of fishing at night on rivers in Japan, using cormorants to dive for fish. The fish caught are usually ayu (sweetfish). A rope on the bird's throat stops them from swallowing the fish they catch. Once they have caught enough fish for the fishers, the birds are fed.

The most famous location for Ukai in Japan is on the Nagara River (Nagaragawa) in Gifu province. The fishing people go out in long wooden boats, with a large wood fire raised up on the boat to light the way.

In this game, players move up the river, a tableau of cards laid face down. As the fishers move up river, the diving birds reveal cards. Some have sweetfish (1 to 5 points), others have hazards, such as the bird striking a rock. Some cards have special effects too. The game ends when all the 'bonfires' in the game are exhausted, meaning time is out. The player with the highest score in fish is the winner.

The game is published in a tiny matchbox box (no striker), with a deck of small cards and includes matches. It was recently shown on Twitter as the smallest doujin game in Japan.

Name: Dungeon Saga: Unholy Crusades
Description:
A new set of adventures for your heroes!

Quest Book + Character Sheets

Also includes the Path of the Righteous adventure

Name: Hollywood Death Race
Description:
This game was never published.

In a not-so distant future where all art forms have been banished, Hollywood is now just a deserted no-man's land.
You and other has-been dopplegangers get together clandestinely inside a huge Hollywood movie studio, where you take part in crazy (we won't say wacky) races, racing through movie set after movie set, desperately looking for (not Susan, but) fame, props... and Effixium (but mostly Effixium).
You've always dreamed of seeing your favorite heroes from the 80's race each other? With Hollywood Death Race, you won't dream it anymore, you'll live it!  Pick your pilot and your vehicle, and throw yourself in a race full of danger, traps and low blows. Don't trust anyone, stay alert, avoid your opponents special attacks and use yours to win the race!

Gameplay:
On your turn you may choose to perform up to 3 actions among: Move, Use one of your vehicle's abilities, ram, honk or repair. 
Each track (movie set) has different rules and you will have to adapt and use them to your advantage in order to outsmart your opponents.
The first player who manages to reach the finish line with his two vehicles wins the race.

-description from publisher

Name: Deception: Undercover Allies – Kickstarter Exclusive "Sorry Pack" Promo Cards
Description:
Given to Kickstarter backers of Deception: Undercover Allies

3 New cards provided as a Kickstarter exclusive:
Sorry Note - Clue
Fire Extinguisher - Means
For Sale Sign - Means

These were packaged separately from the Deception: Undercover Allies box.
Families: Game: Deception – Murder in Hong Kong

Name: Toxic Logic
Description:
Welcome to the card-based party game for adults where you create bizarre and hilarious "IF/THEN" statements, which we call Toxic Logic. The game is easy to learn, portable, and tons of fun for 4 or more adults.

Here’s how it works:

Everyone is dealt 5 magenta “THEN” cards. The Dealer flips over a green “IF” card with the beginning of a conditional statement, like “IF you put a habanero pepper up your butt …” The other players each play one “THEN” card face down to the Dealer. The Dealer shuffles the “THEN” cards and then reads each “IF/THEN” combination:

“IF you put a habanero pepper up my butt …”
“THEN we're in for a big, sloppy surprise”
“IF you put a habanero pepper up my butt …”
“THEN these blueprints are all wrong”
“IF you put a habanero pepper up my butt …”
“THEN my new nickname is 'Sharty McFly'”
The Dealer picks a favorite “THEN” card and reads the winning IF/THEN combination out loud:

“IF you put a habanero pepper up my butt …”
“THEN my new nickname is 'Sharty McFly'”
The player of the winning “THEN” card gets a point. Everyone draws back up to 5 “THEN” cards, and the player to the left of the Dealer becomes the Dealer for the next round. You can keep your winning “THEN” cards to keep track of your own score. The first person to reach 5 points wins the game.

Toxic Logic is great for parties with 4 or more adults. You and your friends will have hours of laughs putting together “IF/THEN” statements which are absurd and so funny. Remember, “Toxic Logic” is not for kids! Some of the cards are filthy, and some of them are bizarre. While there is plenty of adult language and potty humor, rest assured that there is no racist or hate-based content. We want it to be fun for all adults! Put it all together, and you've got almost endless hilarity.

—description from the publisher

Name: The Walking Dead: All Out War – Walker Game Booster
Description:
This booster pack contains 6 Walker miniatures, along with a set of Event cards, and a set of equipment cards exclusive to this set, including the Mossberg 500 Shotgun.

Requires The Walking Dead: All Out War Miniatures Game Core Set to play.
Families: Game: The Walking Dead – All Out War

Name: OrcQuest WarPath: Chapter Box – Blood for Blood
Description:
"Blood for Blood" is a brand new expansion that will enrich the OrcQuest universe with new enemies. With the Secondary Campaign included, your heroes can compete against the Barbarians, this famous warrior folk that can easily compete with the Orcs. Along with Humans, Elves and Dwarves, the Barbarians are one of the major nations to have always been at war with the Orcs... or is it the other way around? Nevertheless, it remains a major problem: a rumor of alliance with the Kingdom of Istarra in the conquest of the Bloody Woods begins to cause trouble among greenskins. Our heroes have thus decided to go to settle their account as they know how best to do it: with brutality.

At first, the heroes will have to return home and repel the Barbarian troops, thrown in the vicinity of the Bloody Woods. Barbarian camps are set up everywhere and our heroes will have to attack and destroy them as quickly as possible, before their enemies gather. The Alert track will be used to generate waves of increasingly powerful enemies.

Through a series of unfortunate events, the heroes find themselves facing Ragnar, the Barbarian King, and will have to entertain him in a battle arena. If they emerge champions in the events, they can challenge the warring regent and compete against him. Be careful, because his strength is legendary. Moreover, as he plays at home, his subjects will not stand by idly. In this situation, the Alert track will serve to measure the enthusiasm of the Barbarian King. The more combos the heroes make, the higher the cursor on the track goes. When the cursor has passed the last level, Ragnar the Barbarian King will finally be eager to descend into the arena.

Name: Sneak Peaks
Description:
Sneak Peaks is an adult NSFW party game of memory, concentration and XXX cartoon boobs.

Sneek Peaks is a naughty game for perverts with a sense of humor. If you are reading this then you most likely are in fact a pervert or know someone who is... *wink*

By definition, pervert means a person whose sexual behavior is regarded as abnormal and unacceptable...

So get ready for a HOT 15 minute funny flashing matching card game.

To play is simple. Just lay out all the cards face down and take turns flipping over 2 cards at a time.

Each scene will be shown a bit different to qualify as a match unlike normal matching games where the image is identical.

The person with the most matches at the end wins!

-description from publisher

Name: Coldwater Crown: Pike Challenge Promo
Description:
Originally available to subscribers of Bellwether Games' newsletter in a limited quantity.

This tile covers the entire Small Species Challenge Section but those trophy tokens are still used.

During the game, you do not earn trophies for completing the Small species challenge. Instead, whenever you catch your third pike, take the topmost trophy from the Pike Challenge stack

Name: Die Nacht der Wehrmacht 1935
Description:
Die Nacht der Wehrmacht 1935 is a game of the factional strife in the Wehrmacht, the unified armed forces of Nazi Germany from 1935 to 1946.
Each player produces troops, performs office hunting by getting "general" cards, commands armed forces in the battle driven by "event" cards and sometimes carries out a coup. If the coup succeeds or WWII ends, the game ends and a player who has been awarded most decorations for victory in the battles wins.

Name: Die Nacht der Wehrmacht 2: The Conqueror of the Orient 1937
Description:
Die Nacht der Wehrmacht 2: The Conqueror of the Orient 1937 is a game of the factional strife in the Army and the Navy of Imperial Japan.
Each player produces troops, performs office hunting by getting "general" cards, commands armed forces in the battle driven by "event" cards and sometimes carries out a coup. If the coup succeeds or WWII ends, the game ends and a player who has been awarded most decorations for victory in the battles wins.

Name: Northern Battle, Sekigahara 1600
Description:
Northern Battle, Sekigahara 1600 is a two-player wargame of the Siege of HasedÅ, the Uesugi clan's attack of the Mogami clan during the Sekigahara Campaign (September 1600 - Keicho 5).
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Siege_of_Hased%C5%8D

This work is designed by Mr. Ryutora Yoshikawa, the designer of "Kawagoe Battle" published in Command Magazine No. 104. The battlefield changes completely when the defeat of the Western Army on the main battle was knowned. It requires speed and judgment to respond to the war situation.

Game scale:

        1 turn = 2 days
        1 hex = about 1km
        1 unit = army including military commanders (100-150 soldiers)


Number of players = 2
    Play time = about 240 minutes

Contents (excluding magazines):

      216 pieces (15 mm square)
       1 map (A1 size)
        1 rule book (12 pages)


(translated and adapted from publisher's website)


Command Magazine Japan #137 issue game

Name: Heroes of Normandie: Gazette #8
Description:
2 punchboards with Captain Pierre Tanant, his Maquisards and German Gebirgsjäger.
     6 page booklet in English:
         Historical information about the fighting in the Vercors massif.
         Scenario “Ambush at the neck of the high cross” – Maquis (200 pts) against Germans (340 pts) (requires Civilians under Fire and 1st SS Panzer division expansions as well as the GE Army Box.)
         Scenario “Valchevrière” – Maquisards (145 pts) against Germans (140 pts) (requires the punchboard FFI or Civilians under Fire.)
         Scenario “Black Wings” – Maquisards (440 pts) against Germans (400 pts) (requires Civilians under Fire expansion and the scenario pack Carentan.)
    
     6 page booklet in French with the same content as the English one.


—description from the publisher

Scenarios require Carentan, German Army Box, and Civilians Under Fire expansions.
Families: Series: Heroes System Tactical Scale World War 2

Name: That's Wizard
Description:
That’s Wizard is a two-player simultaneous-action card game about dueling wizards. Both players will design a deck of seven spell cards to defeat their opponent with. Spells are organized into seven different schools of magic, such as Transfiguration, Charms, Divination, etc. There are over a thousand possible combinations to create your deck with!

You have two resources to manage, stamina which represents your health, and power which is the magical energy that allows you to cast spells. Each spell has a range of power that you can use to cast it, such that it has a greater effect the more power you use.

You will also have access to the two special action cards; Focus and Counterspell. Focus will bring you back to full power, while counterspell will prevent your opponent’s spell from have an effect, causing them to waste the power they used to cast it. Counterspell costs a bit of your own stamina however, and that cost increases the more you use it! Knowing when to focus, and when to counterspell is the key to victory!

The game is played with a simultaneous action mechanic. Each round, both players secretly choose a card from their hand to play, and secretly set a special dial to show how much power they are using with their card. Both players reveal their cards and dials at the same time. Spells that use less power will go before spells that use more.

You will play best two out of three matches. As the game progresses, you will learn more about the cards in your opponent’s hand, and be able to better guess when to counterspell and stop them! No matter how many powerful spells you bring a wizard duel, the key to victory is understanding your opponent!

-description from designer

Name: Whatever the Weather Game
Description:
This is a simple roll and move game.

During set-up, each player takes a coloured playing piece and four teddy weather cards, each depicting a teddy bear dressed for different weather (snowy, windy, sunny, and rainy weather).

On a player's turn, the active player selects one teddy weather card and they then spin the weather spinner. If the weather selected by the spinner matches the teddy weather card chosen by the player, then the player can roll the dice and move that many spots on the board.

If a player lands on a storm cloud space they must return to the start.

The first player to reach the honey pot at the centre of the board wins.

Name: Captain Kangaroo's Colors Game
Description:
This is an educational game for young children to help them learn their colours.

The game contains 36 learning cards, 6 wild cards, and 4 double-sided game boards. With these components, it's possible to play one of the five games in the box.

The five games are:
- Matching Pictures of the Same Color
- Matching Identical Pictures
- Matching Colors to Words
- "Fish" Game 
- Reach for the Rainbow

Name: Pile the Bones
Description:
Pile the Bones is a dexterity game using pieces shaped like long bones. Each player places a bone on the playing surface to form a square base, then each player in turn places a new bone on the pile. The player who places the bone that collapses the pile scores one point for each bone in the pile. If a player plays the last bone without collapsing the pile that player reduces their score by 10 points. The player with the least points after an agreed number of rounds is the winner. Alternatively the players may play on individual piles of bones. In this case, there is no bonus for playing the last bone.

The game is packaged in a plastic barrel similar to Barrel of Monkeys.

Name: Ascension: Gift of the Elements – Lirys, Skirmish Seer Promo Card
Description:
Promo card from the Unrivaled Championships Las Vegas 2017 and pre-ordering Ascension: Gift of the Elements from the publisher.

Lifebound Hero

* Cost 4 Runes
 * Gain 2 Runes
 * Unite: Gain Power equal to the cost of the next Hero you acquire this turn.
 * Value: 3 Honor

Name: AdventureQuest Worlds: The ANYTHING-GOES BattleOn Battle Card Game – Doomwood Mod Pack
Description:
The Adventure Quest Worlds Doomwood Mod Pack includes Vordred's Sword and half of the Paladinslayer class. Combine with the items in the Doomwood mod pack to create the full Paladinslayer class online.

Includes the complete set of 13 Doomwood cards, just mix them with the cards in the base game.

Name: AdventureQuest Worlds: The ANYTHING-GOES BattleOn Battle Card Game – Chaos Mod Pack
Description:
The Adventure Quest Worlds Chaos Mod Pack includes the Chaos eye pet and half of the Paladinslayer class. Combine with the items in the Doomwood mod pack to create the full Paladinslayer class online.

Includes 14 Chaos Cards which are mixed in with the cards in the base set.

Name: Anno
Description:
A trivia game with questions from different time periods in Norwegian history.

Become the first player to reach the level of "Byborger" (Bourgeoisie).

In one of the question category: the first player to answer correctly, gets the points from that question.

Name: ErotiXXX
Description:
ErotiXXX is an adult game for couples that will guide you through a wide-ranging series of erotic challanges.  Your endurance will be tested.  Sometimes blindfolded you won’t always see what’s going on but you will definitely feel it.

The rules are simple. To play, place your tokens on the Start square, and take turns rolling the die. Each die roll is how many spaces on the board you move – then you do what the board or cards direct.  [Sometimes for 2 minutes!]  The first player to reach the final square having fully respected the game rules wins!  The winner chooses where and how to have their final pleasure. If you ‘lose it’ during the game, you lose the game.  But you will never have more fun delaying the outcome of a game.

Make it a hot night to remember for you both with this game.

Game contents include: 1 game board - 1 blindfold - 2 player tokens - 1 die - 3 decks of cards – 1 instruction manual.

Name: Wildlands: The Adventuring Party
Description:
Some see them as heroes, bringing hope to the Wildlands. Others regard them as a menace, a band of criminals that must be stopped at all costs!

Never shying away from danger, a bold adventuring party has joined the fray. This band of hardened wanderers in Wildlands: The Adventuring Party can replace one of the existing factions, with their unique healing ability keeping them in the fight even when hope seems lost, or they can take to the battlefield using the "Encounter" rules to steal crystal shards and attack anyone who gets in their way.

In more detail, when using the adventuring party as a faction, the player controlling them does not assign map cards to their individual characters. Instead, they choose five cards to pass to the player on their right and keep the other five face down. When revealing a character, the player can choose any location they have a map card for, discarding that card. They also bring a new action to the game: heal. Exclusively available to Thom the Cleric, this action allows the player to remove one damage token from a character in the same or an adjacent space.

When used as an encounter, the adventuring party is set up on the board at the start of the game, then at the end of each player's turn the top card of the adventuring party deck is revealed, with the character whose artwork is displayed taking an action. Which action is taken depends on the character and the relative board state. As the game progresses, the troublesome band makes their way around the board, attacking your characters, stealing your loot, and generally causing chaos.

Name: Twilight of the Gods: Elder Gods
Description:
Kickstarter exclusive Deity cards for Twilight of the Gods. This is a set of six Outer Gods and Great Old Ones from the Cthulhu Mythos to add to your games as substitutes for mythological gods.

The set includes Cthulhu, Nyarlathotep, Azathoth, Dagon, Shub-Niggurath and Yog-Sothoth.

It was packaged separately from the base game.

Name: Death Ride: Arras
Description:
The British Counter-Attack at Arras

This game is a collaborative design between Grognard Simulations and Stronpoint Simulations of the British Armies surprise attack on Rommel's 7th Panzer Division at the city of Arras.  This game is a lighter version of the Death Ride series and a good introductory game for the series.

The battle is an interesting situation where the British got the drop on Rommel when the Germans were only considering victory and were too confident of success.  This is where Hitler began to get nervous about the ever extending flank of the German armored spearheads.  Luckily for the Germans the British had poor coordination and poor tanks involved in the attack.  While they made the Germans nervous and gave a few units some real problems they didn't have much of a chance of cutting off the German spearheads.

This two day battle is one of the high points of the French campaign for the Allies.  Players will each find a tense situation at the beginning.  The British must try to push hard as far as they can in order to effect a breakthrough.  The Germans must stave off the breakthrough and hold on until help arrives.  Rommel sent the 25th Panzer Regiment forward and left the softer elements of the division behind.  It's these softer elements that come under attack.  The 25th Panzer Regiment is the help and they had to turn around and go back in order to stop the British attack.

Game Scales are:
- Game Turns are 15 minutes; a change from most other Death Ride series games
- Hex Scale is 330m per Hex
- Most units are platoons, British infantry are companies

Contents - comes with (in Full Color):
(4) Map Sections of the Arras France Area of Operations
(3) Counter Sheets with over 600 Units and Markers
(2) Scenario Cards
(2) d10 and (1) d6
58 Pg. Master Rules (FREE download for those who choose the LITE version)
Supplemental Rules Specific to Arras
Order of Battle Cards
Command and Control Enhancement Built In
Fire Support Enhancement Built In

Name: Gallivant
Description:
A world of knowledge... gallivanting the globe from your home or classroom. Expeditious expeditions of adventure in learning. A geography game played on an authentic and colorfully detailed world map. Fun and educational for teens and adults.

The game comes with four different categories of card (flags, general, capitals, countries).  Players roll and move their pawn on a track.  Each space on the track represents the color of card that must be answered.  In order to move again on the same turn, players must answer their trivia cards correctly.  For flag cards, players are shown a country flag with three possible answers on them.  They must choose the correct answer to move again.  General cards ask various questions related to physical or social geography.  Country cards ask players to identify what country is being referred to on the map (each country of the world has been numbered on the board).  Finally, players must identify the capital city of a specified country when they land on a country card.

To win the game, the player who lands on the finish space and answers one final trivia question correctly wins the game.

Name: Tintin & Tintinors
Description:
Players try to collect objects of the main characters of the Tintin comics: rum of Captain Haddock, the umbrella of Professor Calculus, the music score of Castafiore and the walking sticks of Thompson and Thomson.

When players have collected a set, they get bonuses and they can change the sets for Tintinors (money).

The player that first reaches a number of Tintinors, wins.

Name: Castle Siege Chess
Description:
A two-player chess variant that is played on the CirSquare 96 (a unique circular board merged with a square board). The object of the game is the same as for traditional chess--checkmate the opponent's King.

The board (24"x24", double-sided, quad-fold, custom designed) has 96 spaces and divided into 2 castles of 24 spaces each and a battlefield of 4 rows with 12 spaces each. Numerous initial board setups are possible. Up to 4 additional or new power pieces can be used. The game comes with 2 new optional pieces--Archer and Catapult--which compliment the Knight, Bishop, and Rook.

All the traditional chess pieces move as they do in traditional chess. See the game rules for how the Archer and Catapult move. Castling works like it does in traditional chess only if the standard chess setup for the power pieces is used.

The board has 4 triangular spaces. When a Queen or Bishop moves into a triangle across a corner, it can exit across either of the other 2 corners. When a Queen or Rook moves into a triangle across a side, it can exit across either of the other 2 sides. Thus, the pieces gain an extra path (a 5th path) of coverage when they are aligned with a triangular space, which is often a great advantage, especially in the middle and end games.

—description from the publiser

This entry is 'level 2' of the games contained in Castle Strife Games.  Each level is a game in its own right, but the earlier levels also serve to gradually introduce the rules of Castle Siege.  This level is the most chess-like.

Name: Golden Snitch: Snitch Snatcher – The Quidditch Game: Expansion Set
Description:
Golden Snitch simulates the fast-paced Wizarding game of Quidditch. It is a game of skill and magic to be played by two people, each representing a Hogwarts house team. Use this expansion set to play Golden Snitch with teams Ravenclaw and Hufflepuff. Play them against each other or match one of them against Gryffindor or Slytherin. Play tournaments among the four Hogwarts teams.

Includes:
7 Hufflepuff Playing Pieces
7 Ravenclaw Playing Pieces
2 Sets of Playing Cards
1 Score Pad

Name: Kursk's Southern Front: Prokhorovka 1943
Description:
The Battle of Prokhorovka was fought on 12 July 1943 near Prokhorovka, 87 kilometres (54 mi) southeast of Kursk in the Soviet Union, during the Second World War. Taking place on the Eastern Front, the engagement was part of the wider Battle of Kursk, and occurred when the 5th Guards Tank Army of the Soviet Red Army attacked the II SS-Panzer Corps of the German Wehrmacht in one of the largest tank battles in military history.

Can you break through the enemy lines and fight back with the Red Army. Will you lead the Soviet forces to victory by controlling the clash in the last German attack on the Eastern Front?

This game covers the attack of 4th Panzer Army and Army Detachment Kempf on the southern part of the Kursk salient. Units are randomly assigned tank and equipment chits at start. There are also single-use support chits which include fighters, bombers, heavy artillery, smoke, minefields, engineers, and snipers.

Time scale: 1 day per turn
Game period: July 5-14 1943
Unit scale: German divisions to battalions; Soviet corps to regiments
Counters: 198
Map: A2 (42 x 59.4 cm)



Included with Game Journal #63.

Name: Team Zodiac
Description:
A social deduction game for 3 to 4 players.

Welcome, team. Here is your mission for today. Your task is to liberate the captured base by sending in 12 agents. The good news is that if an agent's identity can be kept hidden, that agent can do the work of two normal agents. However, we believe the enemy may have sent an infiltrator who will try to sabotage our plan.

Team Zodiac may be played using standard playing cards or with the zodiacâ€themed deck found in the files section. Players take turns playing an agent card either face up or face down. Face down cards count double. Some cards may also be used to accuse another player of being the infiltrator. The players win either by playing enough agent cards or by correctly accusing the infiltrator. The infiltrator, if there is one, wins by foiling the playing of agent cards without being detected.

This is an updated version of a game created for the April 2017 24 Hour Contest.

-description from designer

Name: Get Organized
Description:
Get Organized is a mafia-based card and dice game.  The goal is to accumulate 100 or more points by collecting “Industry Cards.”  Each player begins with 1 of each industry card in play (Strip Clubs, Drug Trafficking, Waste Management, Money Laundering, Gambling Ring and Law Enforcement).  Each turn begins with a “Collect” phase, where the player takes $200 from the “stash.”  Then there is a “Purchase” phase, where they player may choose to purchase more industry cards (kept in their hand for now, but not in play) or bullets to attack with.  Next is the “Attack” phase, where the player can choose to roll dice to “shoot the bullets” at another player’s industry cards.  If a 4+ is rolled, the player takes that card and adds it to his/her industry cards in play.  Finally, there is the “Build” phase, which is when a player may play one industry card that was purchased earlier.

The first player to accumulate 3 of any one industry card in play, “owns” that industry and gains the benefits of it (for example, the person who owns the Gambling Ring gets to roll a die during his/her collect phase and collects $100 X the number they roll, in addition to the $200 they already collect).  Every time an industry is taken over, the player who now owns it gets to pull a “Good Earner” card, which can be saved and used at any time (for example, there is a bullet proof vest, which makes bullets only hit on 5’s and 6’s for one attack phase).

After each round, the player with the most industry cards in play (not counting the ones purchased but not played yet) is the “Rat.”  They must pull a rat card, which almost always has a negative action that must be taken.  The Rat goes first in the next round, which isn’t always a good thing.

Each industry card in play is worth 5 points, but once the player owns the industry, all the cards within that industry are worth 10 points for that player.  The game ends when there are one or more players over 100 points at the end of the round (the one with the most points wins).  If someone gets over 100 points in the middle of a round, others can attack that player to reduce their points to less than 100.

—description from the publisher

Name: Fighter in Sight
Description:
Fighter In Sight is an aerial-based game for two players or more, which recounts the WW2 battles.

Minimum length: 45 minutes (Playing can take longer, depending on scenario size and number of players) At the controls of your fighter planes, will you dare you to fight the fearsome Messerschmitt 109E over England, or the famous Japanese Zeros over the Pacific Ocean ? Will you succeed this battle ? Or will you have to escape the flaming wreck ? Fighter In Sight, with its historical scenarios, will allow you to relive this all over again. The game proposes a fresh approach of aerial combat. It will allow you to make mass struggle by involving many squadrons. Fighter In Sight was created with rules that will become more difficult as you play more scenarios. For example, when playing the first scenario you will learn how to use the speedometer. When playing the second one, you will also learn about the fuel management, and so on. The progressive rules have been prepared to address families as well as experienced players. It offers a simple, fast, realistic and easy to assimilate gameplay. It is possible to increase the realism and the difficulty level with additional parameters. Documenting and researching about historical background and technical facts has been an important part of the creation of Fighter in Sight so that the game would respect as much as possible the spirit of air combat, and still remain easy to play.

—description from the designer

Name: 2nd Megiddo: King Josiah vs. Pharaoh Necho II
Description:
Archers, chariots, javelin throwers, infantry, initiative, and the Mount of Megiddo itself all play their part. This is a two player non-card driven war game. The Egyptians have to get 1/3rd of their forces, within a time limit, off the opposite map board edge. The Judeans either have to delay them, or inflict sufficient losses on them. Historically, the Egyptian forces were on their way to help their allies the Assyrians against the Babylonians. To do so, they had to pass through Judean territory. We do not know why Josiah went to war against Egypt. The Assyrian capital, Ninevah, had already fallen to the Babylonians and Medes in 612 (read Nahum). The remaining Assyrian forces had regrouped at Haran, but in 609 they were forced west of the Euphrates. It appears to be at this time that the Egyptians under Necho II were coming to the Assyrian’ aid. King Josiah marched out to meet them in battle. Perhaps Josiah opposed the passage of Necho’s forces through the pass at Megiddo (See 2 Chron.35:20-24) because he feared that the growth of either Egyptian or Assyrian power would have adverse results for the continued independence of Judah. (TKB 2 Kings 23:29). Pharaoh Necho II sent word to Josiah that God had told him to immediately attack Babylon “so stop opposing God who is with me, or He will destroy you.” (35:21) Yet, Josiah refused to accept the word of the Lord from Pharaoh Necho II and went to fight against him on the plain of Megiddo. “Josiah, however, would not turn away from him, but disguised himself to engage him in battle. He would not listen to what Pharaoh Necho II has said at God’s command but went to fight him on the plain of Megiddo.” (35:22) Josiah was wounded by an archer in battle and died in Jerusalem and was buried in the tombs of his fathers (35:23-24). There was great mourning in Judea and Jerusalem. This is 2nd Megiddo, King Josiah vs Pharaoh Necho II. Can you change history?

—description from the publisher
Families: History: Wars in the Ancient Near East

Name: Exodus: Moses vs. Pharaoh
Description:
In Exodus: Moses vs Pharaoh: will you like Moses lead your people out of slavery and into freedom? Will the Hebrew Elders support your leadership? Will a decades old murder charge be brought against you? Will Pharaoh relent and “Let My People Go!” Will Joseph’s Bones be transported for re-burial? Will you plunder the Egyptians to make up for 400 years of slavery? Will Aaron and Hur be at your right and left hand?

As Pharaoh, will you keep the Hebrew slaves in order? Will your building programs proceed on schedule? Will your magicians defeat Moses at his own game? Will the gods of the Egyptians protect Egypt from the great I Am? How will the supernatural plagues be dealt with? Will your chariots crush the slave revolt before they escape across the Red Sea? Will you succeed where your historical counterpart failed?

Exodus is a card driven game of ten turns. Moses must lead the Hebrew people out of Egypt and across the Red Sea to freedom. If Moses fails then Pharaoh wins.

—description from the publisher

Name: Joshua: Hebrews vs. Pagans
Description:
In Joshua: Hebrews vs Pagans, will you, like Joshua, conquer the promised land? Will you avoid the Sin of Achen and the Plague of Peor? Will you be tricked by the Gibeonites? Will Caleb and Othneil be at your right and left hand? Will the Ark of the Covenant remain safely in the hands of Eleazar, Phineas, and the Levites? Will 1 of your soldiers put to flight 1,000 of the enemy?

As the Pagans, how long will Ai hold out? Will you keep Balam the Son of Beor from Hebrew justice? Will you unite to defeat the Hebrews? Will you take advantage of Hidden Movement, Concealed Pieces, Fortified Cities, and Siege Sorties? Will you utilize off-board Ambushes, the Iron Chariots of the Canaanites, and the might of the Philistine Anakin to drive the Hebrew invaders back across the Jordan River?

Joshua is card driven game. Joshua must conquer three of the major tribes, or two of the major tribes and most of the minor tribes in order to win. The Pagans win by stopping Joshua.

—description from the publisher

Name: III Caesars: Roman Civil War of AD 69
Description:
Rome had been a Republic with Senators for about 500 years. Then came the line of emperors: Julius, Augustus, Tiberius, Calligula, Claudius, and then the sixth evil Emperor Nero. After the beast Nero committed suicide in AD 68 after an attempt to prove he was God incarnate, it appeared the Roman Empire had received a fatal wound to its head  (leadership) which could not be healed. Three Caesars: The Roman Civil War of AD 69 re-creates this struggle. Galba, Ortho, and Vitellius engaged in a war where Romans fought against their fellow Romans to see who would become the next emperor of Rome. 
Historically, none of them succeeded, either militarily or politically. Can you succeed where they failed? If not, General Vespasian is on his way to Rome to proclaim himself emperor, and begin the Flavian Dynasty.

III Caesars is a card driven game wherein the first player to get to Rome, conquer it, and acquire 10 political points wins immedaitely.

—description from the publisher

Name: Jet Ace
Description: Jet Ace is a simulation of tactical jet combat from 1944 to the near future.  Over 140 different types of fighters, attack aircraft and bombers are available to be flown on limitless missions.  The basic game is easy to learn and can be played in less than one hour.  From there, you progress to the advanced game, with different types of missiles, bombing missions, electronic countermeasures, anti-aircraft guns, SAMs, helicopters, ships and much more.m

Name: Caverns of Chaos: Tables and Missions for Four Against Darkness
Description:
Chaos is ready to invade the world. Are you up to the challenge?

Caverns of Chaos is the first of a series of themed dungeon supplements. Using the core rules in Four Against Darkness and Four Against the Abyss, you may use this 26 page supplement to generate new missions, meet new monsters, and collect new treasure. The booklet includes six missions, new vermin, minion, boss, weird monsters, treasure and unique event tables, three new dungeon secrets, six new spells.

This is not a stand-alone product. You need a copy of Four Against Darkness (and for some of the content, Four Against the Abyss) to use this book.

Name: Tower of Mages
Description:
As long as there has been magic, there have been Mages' Towers. Tall, dilapidated structures built in wild curves to tap into elemental energy. As the Solstice approaches, three Wizards break ground on what they're sure will be... Well, it will be a tower anyway.

Tower of Mages is a dice game for one player. Each of your three dice represents a scatterbrained wizard with a short attention span. Over the course of the game they will be working together to build a tower to gather elemental energies, convert them into valuable spells, and to predict and manipulate the spell market.

The game uses a sort-of-rondel mechanic. You roll your dice and choose which order to play them in. Each time you use a die, you count down the list of tower segments, starting at the last segment built.

There is also a market speculation aspect, all Elements begin at a value of -2. As the game progresses, you will roll dice to see how values grow and fall. To make the best of this, you can build high value rooms, destroy negatively valued rooms, cap towers to score them early, and gain rerolls to adjust the outcomes of the market.

All you need to play is the PDF, three standard dice and a pencil.


Released in the January 2018 Board Game of the Month Club $5+ package.

Name: Sailing Toward Osiris: Governors & Envoys
Description:
This expansion appends to the usual setup and game play rules. Each aspect of this expansion pack (Governors, Objectives, Envoys, and Boon of Ra) is modular and may be added to your game individually, all together, or in any combination.

The governor cards give a Governor a special privilege to use during play.

The objective cards describe a certain configuration of monuments that will, if achieved, give a Governor bonus glory points at the end of the game.

The Boon of Ra card modifies that Governors build action for the remainder of the current season.

Envoys reserve terrain section or city spaces for your use in a later action.

-description from publisher

Name: Assassin's Creed: Arena – Hookblade Promo Card
Description: Pre-order bonus of a Hookblade promo card from the Cryptozoic Store.

Name: Tabu
Description:
Gaming. Easy to learn but particularly captivating, previously known in Belgium under the name of "Anchor and Sun", banned in public in that country. The board consists of 6 squares, illustrated with the sign of the clover, hearts, diamond, spades, anchor and sun.

Three dice are provided with these same symbols. Players can bet game money in one or more squares of the board.

The player who plays the "banker" in each turn rolls the dice, and depending on what the players have bet and what the dice indicate on the table, the players can win 1 to 3 times the bet amount or lose it between 1 and 2 times.

Name: Grimmsdorf
Description:
Grimmsdorf is a 2-4 player coöperative town-building game of lore, exploration, and survival set in a dark fairytale forest sometime in Europe's distant past. In this world of struggle and ignorance, wearied villagers are never sure where reality ends and fantasy begins. Fairies, famines, wolves, and witches seem to lurk around every bend. Real history and oral mythologies are blended together in one world of mystery, fear, and adventure.

Players have to work together to avoid starvation, overcome magickal curses, build up their town, and explore the vast wilderness beyond their small world if they want a chance to survive. The themes and mechanics are tightly woven together, to create a rich and compelling experience for players.

If they don't meet a trickster dwarf or a pack of hungry wolves first, 40 unique fairytale characters - both familiar and obscure - can strike out on their adventures based on their original fairytales. They'll have to balance their thirst for glory with the need to work the land, and construct helpful buildings such as apothecaries, scriptoriums, and hunting lodges. But if they succeed, their stories will live on and they can become the stuff of legend.

Games run between 90-150 minutes and involve a mix of autonomous actions and team strategizing. Players work to feed the town while also playing through their characters' stories (which ultimately garners point and satisfies the win condition). When certain terrain tiles are discovered via exploration, they can farm or harvest resources to build new buildings, which in turn multiply the yield from these resource tiles. Buildings also boost characters' stat points (Charm, Fortitude and Wit; tracked on a household ledger) which helps them satisfy the requirements to start on their stories (for example, Snow White needs a certain amount of charm to be the fairest of them all and start on her story). When a new terrain tile is uncovered, players also have a chance for an event card, bring additional narrative elements to the game - and in this way players can explore and adventure independently of their story and of other players' actions. The risks and rewards increase the farther from town a character strays.

Name: Steamcode
Description: Steamcode is a strategic game. Players have to find the code, made up of 6 numbers, to power up the Time Machine.The first player who find the code win the game. The game is set in the flying laboratory of the brilliant Jonathan Steam. Players can speed up their search with the cards in their hand,or set traps to slow down their opponents.The laboratory is full of invention, bad or good, no one knows,till you show them up

Name: Scoria
Description:
Scoria is a deck building game for 1-2 players. In Scoria players adventure within a cavern beneath an erupting volcano. The players seek the idols that hold the power of the ancients- if awoken, balance can be restored to the island. The player who has gathered the most power by invoking the ancients will win.
The players start with a basic deck of spell cards - these cards are used to accumulate more powerful spell cards or to win the favor of an idol. Each idol has a requirement for how much spirit the player must have in their hand - spirit comes in 6 different types - and each spell card could contain a variety as well. In addition to invoking the idols, the spells a player accumulates through drafting can be used to negatively effect their opponent, or positivity effect themselves. Once a player has obtained the favor of three idols the game ends - and players total their power; each idol has an associated power value. The player with the most power wins.

Name: Shards of Infinity: Gian, Shard Wyrm Promo Card
Description: Shards of Infinity: Gian, Shard Wyrm is a single card promo for the Shards of Infinity base game that gives you a giant wyrm that you can exhaust to gain 2 power and 2 health. Once you reach 15 mastery, you instead gain 5 power and 5 health.

Name: Clank! In! Space!: Apocalypse!
Description:
The deck-building adventure of Clank! In! Space! continues in Clank! In! Space! Apocalypse! Small pockets of resistance continue to oppose Lord Eradikus, but the evil cyborg now plots to wipe them out with one grand and wicked scheme!

Your challenge? Thwart the efforts of Lord Eradikus! Reap the rewards of noble (and sometimes reluctant) heroism! Save the galaxy…and get rich in the process! Maybe you can avert the Apocalypse! (Or at least escape with the treasure while someone else does!)
 This expansion requires Clank! In! Space! to play.

Game Box Contains:

2 Double-sided Game Board Modules
35 Adventure Deck Cards
8 Large Scheme Cards
1 Haldos Boss Marker

Name: OrcQuest WarPath: Chapter Box – Elven Vestiges
Description:
"Elven Vestiges" is a brand new expansion that will enrich the OrcQuest universe with new enemies. With the Campaign Chapter included, your heroes can venture into the ruins of ancient Elven temples. The Elves have left a precious relic that will be of great use to our Orc heroes, and these haughty beings have decided to return to take possession of their remains.

Our heroes will have to progress with caution. To approach the ruins, they must be vigilant and not be spotted by the Elven Archers hidden in the trees. Each escaping Elf Archer will increase the Alert Level, and the higher the Alert Level, the more Elven Archers will shoot at you from the trees.

If the Heroes manage to penetrate the vestiges, they will have to face the Elves who protect the place. Their magic is frightening and will keep the Orcs at bay. And that's not counting the traps set in the Event cards, like the giant ball!

Name: The Road Crew
Description:
Take on the role of a roadie, and help your band become the most popular act at the biggest music festival of the year!

'Juice' their songs, sort out event issues and sabotage other bands to GAIN the most fans by the end of your set list!

In this fun, fast paced, take that game, each player tries to assist their band in gaining as many fans as possible during their 12 song set list.

Each song can create new fans providing the roadie has the skills (in the shape of 4 unique tokens) to ‘juice’ their band’s songs. The more tokens used, the more fans the players can chuck into the moshpit.

However, they may need to keep some energy in reserve as Every festival has it’s share of unfortunate events, and this one is no exception.

Throw into the mix the other roadies trying to sabotage your  stage and gear, you know you’ve got your hands full trying to be the best band on the biggest stage!

Name: Cards Against Humanity: Dad Pack
Description:
Surprise! This DVD case is actually the Cards Against Humanity Dad Pack, and fatherhood is actually a trap that lures virile men into lives of tinkering with thermostats and shopping for bargain DVD's. The Dad Pack includes 30 totally new cards about the joys of fatherhood. Happy Father's Day!

PLEASE NOTE: This items’ packaging is assorted, styles vary. You will receive 1 randomly chosen Cards Against Humanity Dad Pack with each order. All these different DVD cases contain the same 30 cards.

~ From the Publisher

Name: Girl Genius: The Works – Castle Wulfenbach
Description:
Girl Genius: The Works is a non-collectible card game that consists of several standalone decks of cards. You can play the game with any one of those decks, while also being able to combine some or all of those decks into a single deck for a longer game or a game with more players. Each deck contains many unique cards, but the gameplay is the same in all cases.

Each player gets a five-card hand and twelve cards are laid out face-down in a patchwork pattern. Each card has colored symbols along each side, as well as a point value and special instructions. On your turn, you reveal one face-down card, then spin any face-up card 180º. After spinning, if any of the symbols on the edges of the spun card match the symbols on one or more of the surrounding cards, you "pop" the card(s) with the most matching symbols. "Popping" a card means that you must follow the instructions on the card (whether helpful or harmful), then (usually) add it to your score pile. Cards in your hand are used to replace any popped cards. The game is played until one player has 70/50/40/30 points with two/three/four/more than four players.

The Castle Wulfenbach deck has two large groups of unique cards: six Jägermonsters and seven Dingbots. The Jägers are troublemakers: They are all Soldiers, and they all pop one Soldier, so if you pop one of them, you just might get them all! But their second effects are not always so great: They include "Let another player draw a card from your score pile", "Let another player draw three cards from your hand", and "Put this card in another player's score pile."

The Dingbots like to clump together — they are like the Mimmoths from the original edition of Girl Genius: The Works, who are returning in the Circus deck — but they're not quite as talented as the Mimmoths. Most of them say "Move one Dingbot from another player's score pile into yours", although Dingbot Prime is as strong as a Mimmoth and able to grab them all.

Name: Welded Iron
Description:
Lore:
In an alternate 19th century world created by artist Nicholas Maxson-Francombe, machines have been built to serve as soldiers. Fires burn in their heads, keeping their engines running and they survive a hail of bullets. Princess Feodora has taken control of London, which has now been turned into Clockwork City.

Machines were given more and more autonomy and control - punchcards passed between soldiers and seers. Now, the machines seem to have developed some sort of consciousness and no-one has heard from Feodora in years.

In Edinburgh, re-engineering has gone awry and a new set of machines has arisen, wanting nothing less than the decimation of every potential problem in the land - including humans!

Clockwork City is being invaded, this is the moment for the human captives of Clockwork City to escape.

Welded Iron allows players to either play as the Imperial machines defending their tyranny over Clockwork City, or as human heroes who strive to escape.

The Imperials want to keep the humans as slaves and keep their infrastructure intact. The humans want to avoid casualties and use the chaos to evacuate the city. In the end, everyone might survive but this is just the start of the war.

Gameplay:
Welded Iron is a tower defense yet competitive game of an uneasy asymmetric alliance between one player: the imperial machine overlords and the other human factions. The imperial machines will use iron and steel resources to build and maintain infrastructure, while also ensuring area control over regions where humans work and live. Each player will have asymmetric powers to reflect the differences in strengths and objectives. For instance, The imperials will have powers which help to quickly build up defense infrastructure from the invading machines of the North, while also utilizing passive human "resources" to help in those goals. The human factions will have formed an alliance with one another after the grueling human wars in a bid to overthrow their imperial overlords. Their objectives are at odds with the imperials, as they must extract and rescue as many humans in clockwork city, and beyond to win, yet also defending the city from invasion.

The game utilities randomly allocated hex tiles with positions in which towers are built for defense and attack, with regions to place electricity to power these up. The hex tiles also contain unknown bonus resources, with higher more valuable resources closer to the invading camps of the north. The imperial and human factions must work together to defeat an AI controlled invasion force or face annihilation, while also working towards their own objectives to win.

Designed by acclaimed medium-heavy weight designer David Turczi, Welded Iron will please those looking for a new fresh take on tower defense games, with many miniatures available.

-description from publisher

Name: Girl Genius: The Works – Master Payne's Circus of Adventure
Description:
Girl Genius: The Works is a non-collectible card game that consists of several standalone decks of cards. You can play the game with any one of those decks, while also being able to combine some or all of those decks into a single deck for a longer game or a game with more players. Each deck contains many unique cards, but the gameplay is the same in all cases.

Each player gets a five-card hand and twelve cards are laid out face-down in a patchwork pattern. Each card has colored symbols along each side, as well as a point value and special instructions. On your turn, you reveal one face-down card, then spin any face-up card 180º. After spinning, if any of the symbols on the edges of the spun card match the symbols on one or more of the surrounding cards, you "pop" the card(s) with the most matching symbols. "Popping" a card means that you must follow the instructions on the card (whether helpful or harmful), then (usually) add it to your score pile. Cards in your hand are used to replace any popped cards. The game is played until one player has 70/50/40/30 points with two/three/four/more than four players.

Master Payne's Circus of Adventure contains story elements from Agatha's time in the circus as well as her visit to Sturmhalten. Unique character blocks in this deck include Circus Cards, Mimmoths, and some fairly nasty Villains. Roughly ten cards in this deck are part of Master Payne's traveling circus. Although these Circus Cards have different effects, popping some — such as André and Lars — grant you an automatic win if you have five or more Circus Cards in your score pile!

Many of the other cards are designed specifically to help you get closer to the Circus Card goal. Baba Yaga, for example, lets you steal a Circus Card from another player's score pile. The Horse Monster Beastie, on the other hand, scares all the Circus Cards from play back into the deck!

The Mimmoths — tiny, wooly, adorable mammoths — travel in herds, so whenever you pop one of them, you get to steal all the others from every player's score pile! Though Mimmoths are only worth three points each, there are six of them in the deck, and they can snowball into an 18-point block.

Name: Girl Genius: The Works – Castle Heterodyne
Description:
Girl Genius: The Works is a non-collectible card game that consists of several standalone decks of cards. You can play the game with any one of those decks, while also being able to combine some or all of those decks into a single deck for a longer game or a game with more players. Each deck contains many unique cards, but the gameplay is the same in all cases.

Each player gets a five-card hand and twelve cards are laid out face-down in a patchwork pattern. Each card has colored symbols along each side, as well as a point value and special instructions. On your turn, you reveal one face-down card, then spin any face-up card 180º. After spinning, if any of the symbols on the edges of the spun card match the symbols on one or more of the surrounding cards, you "pop" the card(s) with the most matching symbols. "Popping" a card means that you must follow the instructions on the card (whether helpful or harmful), then (usually) add it to your score pile. Cards in your hand are used to replace any popped cards. The game is played until one player has 70/50/40/30 points with two/three/four/more than four players.

The Castle Heterodyne deck includes themes and characters from Agatha's time in Castle Heterodyne, and her early days in Mechanicsburg. There are two major blocks of cards in this deck: Prisoners and Minions. Castle Heterodyne is a huge semi-conscious prison, and many of the characters in the story are stuck there. Thus, the Castle says, "If you have four Prisoners in your Score Pile right now, you win." But accumulating four of them can sometimes be pretty painful. Some of them mess up the board when you pop them, screwing up your plans. Others mess with your hand and Score Pile.

The nine Minions in this deck have both good effects and bad, with other cards providing support for Minions.

Name: Girl Genius: The Works – The Siege of Mechanicsburg
Description:
Girl Genius: The Works is a non-collectible card game that consists of several standalone decks of cards. You can play the game with any one of those decks, while also being able to combine some or all of those decks into a single deck for a longer game or a game with more players. Each deck contains many unique cards, but the gameplay is the same in all cases.

Each player gets a five-card hand and twelve cards are laid out face-down in a patchwork pattern. Each card has colored symbols along each side, as well as a point value and special instructions. On your turn, you reveal one face-down card, then spin any face-up card 180º. After spinning, if any of the symbols on the edges of the spun card match the symbols on one or more of the surrounding cards, you "pop" the card(s) with the most matching symbols. "Popping" a card means that you must follow the instructions on the card (whether helpful or harmful), then (usually) add it to your score pile. Cards in your hand are used to replace any popped cards. The game is played until one player has 70/50/40/30 points with two/three/four/more than four players.

The Siege of Mechanicsburg deck features characters and themes from the great battle for Mechanicsburg.

Name: The Big Score: Crack the Safe
Description:
Crack the Safe, an expansion for The Big Score, adds 2 new Job cards and 20 Safe cards. Players that successfully rob these new locations get to draw from the Safe deck to see what reward awaits inside the safe!

This expansion also includes an upgrade pack with 2 new Bosses and matching Assignment Tiles as well as clay poker chips to replace the cardboard Jack of All Trades tokens that come with the base game.

Name: Dumpster Dealers
Description:
Persuade your friends to buy absurd products in this hilarious NSFW party game.

We believe great party games should encourage you to express your own sense of humor, not just rely on each card to be a pre-written punchline. That's why we created Dumpster Dealers.

Dumpster Dealers is a hilarious game of creative persuasion.
Here's how it works:
1. Choose a Customer
One person draws a Dumpster Dollar and chooses a role to adopt from either side of the card. They will be determining the winner of the round

2. Create Products
Everyone else quickly combines two of their Dumpster Cards into something the Customer might want.

3. Pitch Your Products
Each player attempts to persuade the Customer why their ridiculous card combination is best. Hilarity ensues.

4. The customer awards the Dumpster Dollar to their favorite product, ending the round. The winnner gets to be the customer for the next round.

That's the main sequence of gameplay, not including the addition of bonus rounds, extra house rules, or drinking game rules.

—description from the designer

Name: Munchkin Fowl Play
Description:
Get all the silly chicken, turkey, and duck jokes you've ever wanted with Munchkin Fowl Play! This mini-expansion is illustrated by John Kovalic and written by Steve Jackson — the original Munchkin duo. Plus, it comes with original fantasy backs so you can add poultry flavor to all your Munchkin games!

—description from the publisher

Name: Munchkin Collectible Card Game: Phat Pack
Description:
The Munchkin Collectible Card Game: Phat Pack contains three Munchkin CCG core booster packs, one The Desolation of Blarg booster, one Fashion Furious booster, and two surprise (new!) Munchkin CCG cards randomly chosen from twelve possibilities!

—description from the publisher

Name: slash2: thirst blood
Description: Slash 2: Thirst Blood is a standalone sequel to Slash. Players compete to create the One True Pairing by choosing popular culture figures from their hand of cards to pair with the character chosen by the matchmaker. If the matchmaker chooses your card, you win the round, and score those points. If they don't choose your card, you can petition the table to override the matchmaker by telling a short fanfic story of your choice.

Name: Wake Island: A Heroic Defiance
Description:
A Few Men Against the Might of the Japanese Empire

War has broken out in the Pacific with the Attack on Pearl Harbor. Now Japan moves for its next target Wake Island. Japanese forces have been sweeping across the Paci c attacking other US bases. The American forces on Wake Island were told they would be rescued if war broke out. The US Marines and civilian construction workers must hold out against overwhelming odds brought to bear on them by the Imperial Japanese Navy. Wake Island a Heroic Defiance incorporates both the air and sea components of the battle. Players can play either the Japanese or American forces.

—description from the publisher

Name: Kemet: Seth
Description:
In the heart of the delta, a dark purple gleam streaks the skies, filling your troops hearts with fear. An ancient god awakens, his cruelty matched only by his fury.

In Kemet: Seth, you can embody the all-powerful jackal-headed god or become one of the members of a force who will have to coordinate together to save the black lands! The time of the fratricidal wars is over. The time has come to unite against the common enemy. But who will win? The alliance of players, or the cruel power of Seth?

Kemet: Seth allows you to play the game with up to six players in a "one vs. all" version of Kemet, with the "all"co-operating to stop the invasion of Seth, while also needing to resist their powerful powers of corruption. Seth will benefit from his own power tiles, his own board, his own creatures, and his own Divine Intervention cards. The community will be able to count on the powerful Osiris, temples to build, and new rules allowing them to co-operate better by creating, for example, mixed troops.

Kemet: Seth is compatible with the black pyramid, the new tiles, and the new Ta-Seti divine intervention cards.

Name: Bolt Action: Campaign – The Western Desert
Description:
One of the most popular and enduring campaigns of World War II is that of the Western Desert, where Allied armies beat back the hard-pressed German and Italian forces under the gruelling African sun. Covering crucial operations such as Crusader, Lightfoot, and Supercharge, and the great battles of Tobruk, El Alamein, and Gazala, this book brings the unforgiving battlefields of North Africa to the tabletop. In-depth information on the forces involved, linked scenarios, and new Theatre Selectors make this an ideal resource for any Bolt Action player with an interest in the Desert War.

-From the publisher's website

Name: Vikings Gone Wild: Dice of Destiny promo card
Description:
A promotional set of three cards offered during the "Dice Tower - 2018" Kickstarter campaign.

This card goes in the Odin's Path deck.
Cost: 3 beer
Effect: Draw 3 cards.
Keep 1 and discard the other two.

Name: Cosmic Run: Regeneration – Allies Pack
Description:
The Allies expansion pack includes 6 ally cards (plus 2 instruction cards) that add an interesting twist by giving players special powers.  Each ally card has an icon with a die, numbered from 1 to 6. At the end of a player's turn, the player recruits the ally whose number matches the yellow die.  The player may then use the ally on future turns until another player recruits the ally.

This expansion was included as a bonus freebie for all Kickstarter pledges.

Name: Air Flix: El Alamein
Description:
Relive the epic tank battle at El Alamein with Annihilation Mode. Both sides use a combination of fighters and bombers to obliterate the opposing player's tanks!

The Air Flix: El Alamein battle pack is a standalone game and contains:


    The El Alamein 3’ x 3’ neoprene battle mat
    Plane Minatures & Acrylic Discs
        3 Hawker Hurricanes
        3 Junkers Ju 87 (Stukas)
        3 P40 Warhawks
        3 Focke-Wulf FW-190s
    
    10 Pilot Cards
    6 Ace Pilot Cards
    1 Bombing Map
    15 Bomb Tokens
    2 Squadron Boards
    2 Ranging Sticks
    5 Combat Dice
    Scenario rules for Annihilation Mode


—description from the publisher

Name: Quiz Quoz
Description:
Quiz Quoz is a fast, fun trivia game anyone can win. Think a traditional quiz meets tic-tac-toe meets bingo, with three unique strands of luck that mean even a beginner can beat a brainbox.

The game takes a minute to learn, is family-friendly and takes 15-30 minutes to play.

So whether you're into Shakespeare, the Super Bowl, Star Wars or Subatomic particle physics, please support our kickstarter and help make Quiz Quoz a reality.

How To Play:

1) A Player or Team selects one of the game boards to play, then rolls a six-sided die.
2) The outcome of the die roll indicates the difficulty of the question they are asked.
3) If you answer correctly, you place a counter on the corresponding number on your Quiz Quoz game board.  Each game board is a random 3x3 grid of numbers from 1-9.  Each box contains one of the numbers and there are no duplicates.
4) The winner of the game is the player/team that completes a vertical, horizontal or diagonal straight line on their Quiz Quoz game board.

Components:
171 Cards (1026 Questions)
1 Six-Sided Die
6 Game Boards
36 Counters
Rulesheet

Name: What Do You Meme?: Game of Thrones Photo Expansion Pack
Description:
Winter is here!
Our most binge-worthy expansion pack ever made
Your chance to meme Cersei, Jon Snow, Tyrion Lannister, and all your favorite Game of Thrones characters
75 Photo Cards to be added to core game


    Requires What Do You Meme? core game to play


—description from the publisher
Families: Books: A Song of Ice and Fire

Name: Subdue
Description:
Subdue is a card game of capture and control which takes place in a legendary universe where Kings and their Dragons fight for Castles supremacy.

Unfold your strategy in an intriguing and fun-to-play game with up to 6 players in free for all or cooperative mode.

Objective:

To achieve the desired victory, you must be the first to control two Castles with your full army or achieve the highest score at the end of the game.

Game Set-up:

The secret playing cards are placed facedown in a row at the center of the game table.

The special cards are placed in a pile next to the secret cards.

Each player chooses randomly half (6) of his playing cards as a starting hand.

Each player takes his inactive King army card and places it in front of him.

Each Player Turn:

1. Play: Play a card either directly from the hand or after an exchange with one card from secret cards on the table (obligatory stage)

2. Expansion: Developing the army (king and dragons) and purchasing special cards (optional stage)

3. Magic: use Magic special cards to affect the status of own King or other players Kings (optional stage)

4: Conflict: attack adversaries to gain control over Castles and use Conflict special cards (optional stage)

Components:
108 Cards

Name: Boss Monster: Kingkiller Hero Pack
Description:
Introducing the limited edition pack of hero cards for Boss Monster, a dungeon-building game inspired by classic video games! This pack includes six all-new hero cards: five ordinary unique heroes (Auri, Denna, Elodin, Kilvin, and Vashet) as well as one epic hero (Kvothe).
